intro: Peucedanum mohavense, commonly known as Mohave cowparsley, is a rare flowering plant native to the deserts of the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant has a taproot system that allows it to survive in arid conditions by storing water and nutrients. Its flowers are typically greenish-yellow, and it blooms in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
